headline: Best Egg Rolls
description: Crispy, homemade egg rolls filled with a seasoned mixture of pork, cabbage, and carrots are a fabulous side dish to serve alongside stir-fry dishes, so skip takeout!

video.name: How to Make the Best Egg Rolls

name: Best Egg Rolls
recipeIngredient: 1 teaspoon ground ginger, or more to taste
1 teaspoon garlic powder, or more to taste
1 quart peanut oil for frying, or as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Season pork with ginger and garlic powder in a large bowl; mix until thoroughly combined.
Place pork in a medium skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir until pork is browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes.
Combine cooked pork, cabbage, and carrots in a large bowl; mix until egg roll filling is well combined. Mix four and water together in a small bowl until a paste forms.
Heat oil in a large skillet to about 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) or medium high heat.

While oil is heating, prepare egg rolls: Lay one egg roll wrapper on a work surface with one corner pointed toward you like a diamond. Place about 1/4 to 1/3 cup of the filling in the center of the wrapper.
Fold the bottom corner up and over the filling. Fold the left and right corners in toward the center. Push the egg roll away from you and roll toward the top corner.
Brush a bit of the flour paste over the inside of that corner to help seal the egg roll.
Fry egg rolls in the hot oil, turning occasionally, until golden brown and crispy, 5 to 8 minutes. Remove from oil and drain on paper towels or rack.
Place egg rolls on a serving plate and sprinkle sesame seeds over top.

review.reviewBody: I used coslaw mix to skip a step. Instead of buying and cutting up the cabbage and carrots. It helps .
So the recipe was good but for the blades I found it was easiest to use breakfast sausage and it still tasted amazing
Add salt and pepper to pork

I agree with others - the recipe as written is extremely bland. The number one rated 5 star review (Snowflake) literally made five major changes to this recipe and still gave it five stars. I think the rating of this recipe is definitely skewed by all the changes people made and still gave 5 stars. I made it as written the first time around so my review would be fair. I'll make it again like Snowflake did next time.
Instead of using cabbage I have been using saurkraut. Well rinsed and dried. It helps that I like saurkraut.
I use coleslaw mix, add bean sprouts. Will sub eggs for meat ( just fry a couple up with the cabbage and sprouts) Also can be baked by spraying cooking spray or brushing with olive oil at 325
I tried this recipe with a few tweaks, I added kroger stir fry seasoning pouch. I cooked the cabbage then drained it, put onions and sausage in and it was delicious

So you definitely need to add some hoisin sauce, a little sesame oil,soy sauce along with salt ,garlic powder,and pepper to taste. Allow the cabbage to wilt all the way, additionally I added a small yellow onion sauteed. Definitely a game changer and oh so good.

These are incredibly bland and flavorless. The first time I mad them I was highly disappointed. The second time I adjusted the recipe and double the spices and added salt, pepper, soy sauce and it turned out much better

I followed the recipe, tasted it and was like ok its bland. I read peoples comments and added more ginger and more garlic and more onion powder, still bland, added more, still bland, so i added soy sauce, eh..still not that great but I had to keep moving. I rolled them and fried them and they were just ok. They definately needed dipping sauce and all I had was soy sauce so I dipped them in that and it was better. The next day I bought some sweet and sour sauce and tried again and it was better, but only because they were sauce ladden. The veges inside dont have enough time to cook because the egg roll wrapper cooked in a few minutes. So there was a crunch factor to the inside which I like anyways. I often cook for the neighbors and they liked it ( but are they really going to tell me my cooking sucks? no) my standards are higher than theirs. Im not a negative hater of this persons recipe, it is something I may make again but with a lot more tweaks based off this original. No wonder egg rolls cost $$$ at a restaurant because they are so time consuming to make aswell! I am a white girl so I will leave the asian cuisine up to the asians who have their own little secrets that make them yummy.

I have no idea where these rave reviews are coming from, because it was super bland. I even added soy sauce the filling. There is no flavor, other than oil. I was so disappointed. I was excited by the good reviews, but I don‚Äôt know how we made the same recipe and people had such great things to say. These were majorly disappointing.
Delicious but lacks flavour, definitely add some more spice and SALT!!!. I also fried the pork with olive oil and turned out great üëç.
Recipe sounds good but I would have to substitute pork with beef or chicken. Don't eat PORK ‚ÄºÔ∏è
My grandkids and I made these as a fun cooking project. We had fun both making and eating them. Easy and delicious.
Easy Recipe. I made a couple small changes but you don't want to hear about that. I did make a double batch and the other half was shrimp.
Good basic recipe. I used pork chops cut into small chunks that I had left over. Best thing is this website no pop ups not much advertising just people sharing recipes. Right on! Go all recipes.

To call these the best is certainly ambitious. We both felt they were completely lacking in flavor and after going over the recipe again and reading comments, I understand why. Garlic and ginger, that's it. Bland. Tasteless. Maybe add some white pepper, soy sauce, spring onion greens, and fresh ginger next time? Also, the conundrum of this: How am I supposed to fit one pound of ground meat, two cups of shredded cabbage, and 2 oz. of carrots into EIGHT wrappers using only 1/4 to 1/3 cup mixture each? Am I reading that wrong? We needed the entire pack and over-stuffed quite a few. 

The reviews for this recipe are deceiving, many of the 5 star reviews are based off of reviewers adding additional spices or sauces to their egg rolls, that doesn't reflect on the true recipe. This recipe is a good base.
This is my go-to egg roll recipe. So much better than take out. After frying, I freeze them by wrapping individually in waxed paper, then reheat in the oven.
It could have used more seasoning. Seems like it was missing something. Rather bland. I will play around with it.

I mean, they aren't bad. I followed the recipe, and yes, correctly. They just lack flavor, and taste nothing like what I am used to at a restaurant, which, with any home recipe I accept that they won't be quite the same. I can't quite put my finger on it, but definitely needs more seasoning, maybe some sesame oil or something similar. Though I think I would look to try other egg roll recipes that perhaps have a little more to them than this one, as it is simply, too simple.
it was ok

this is so delicious...i get so many compliments with this recipe...few upchanges that i make...i use fresh ginger and fresh garlic, minced...i also double the recipe and use canola oil in my deep fryer, i do saute vegetables s first to soften and add pork afterwards (usually i mince up from pork chops not just ground pork but whichever is fine)... i do add a little soy or hoison for added flavor, drain well before starting to wrap
I also put green onions in it and cut up shrimp. We don‚Äôt use grease anymore because of my stomach so we air fried it and turn turned out great, grandson said I want more...

Recipe as is, it's a little bland. I added a little bit of soy sauce and salt and pepper. Made it a little more flavorful. I think adding chopped celery would do the trick and make it taste more authentic. Pretty easy to make, turned out great.
We are definitely going to make these again. We used ground beef for ours to try out and we ended up with about 24 egg rolls made so we froze half of them in packages of 4.

I love this recipe! I have made it several times now and I decided I prefer them without the ground pork. Basically I just use a bag of cole slaw mix for the filling and adjust the seasonings to the amount that's in the bag. The first time I made these I showed them to my husband, who said, "Nice - these are frozen, right?" "No hubs, I made them." He assumed I was pulling his leg because said they look just like the ones we used to buy. Only these taste so much better! The only drawback is now I don't have an excuse to order out for Chinese food anymore. Thanks for sharing the recipe.
Good base recipe. I add to mine 3 Tbsp soy sauce in lieu of water, 2Tbsp shred onion, 1 Tbsp hoisin sauce, 1 tsp sesame oil, and fresh ginger instead of powdered. Fantastic.
This recipie was delicious. My family loved it.

So easy to make! I also double up on the carrots and cabbage and saut√©ed them in water and soy. I also double up on the ginger and garlic. I thought I could roll them in the morning and fry them that night which turned the wraps into mush. So I pulled out the filling and wrapped them up fresh.
I made these with Phyllo bread and ground pork. Best egg rolls I've ever had! I frozen the rest so I can make more Phyllo and make them again!

I made these last night and my family absolutely devoured them. They were fantastic! I added salt and pepper, and a tablespoon of hot mustard to the filling to give them a bit of a bang. I also could not find egg roll wrappers and used spring roll wrappers instead. They turned out fantastic!
For the first time making egg rolls they turned out awsome and the recipe was so easy . I will never order my egg rolls from a take out

I made these they were delicious, I cut out the oil mostly and air fried them. I made them spicy by adding 4 jalapenos and 2 small habaneros and it made 13 egg rolls. They were all gone in an hour and a half between 3 of us! lol

These were really easy to do and tasty. I did saut√© the cabbage and carrots a bit and also added some red pepper for a little heat along with some soy sauce. The mixture otherwise is bland. Two tips: 1. make sure the mixture is dry otherwise your egg roll will get soggy and 2. Make sure your oil stays at 375 for temp or the roll will absorb too much of the oil. Totally a hit and will do again.
So simple, yet turned out so good. Family loved them. I would say that the 1/3 cup filling recommendation is a bit low and I recommend putting a bit more filling in each egg roll.
Easy to make.
Good flavor, but I think the egg roll wrappers I got made it taste really floury! In addition, NOT recommended for air fryer LOL
I used chopped pork and added some 5 spice. Could have used more seasoning. Very easy to make.

Delicious! Added teaspoon each of minced ginger root and garlic to cabbage and cooked for about a minute. I also added 1/2 cup of drained cooked spinach to "green" it up. Popped them in the freezer. Thank you.
We made them today and were happy with the results. We used shrimp instead of pork. Very tasty and crispy.
These were the Best Egg Rolls! Very easy to make and more authentic than my local Chinese restaurant! They may never see me again!
I made this exactly to the directions, and the pork was very bland. If I make this again with pork (not sure I will) I'll use a lot more seasoning.

I just made this recipe and followed others suggestions to add more garlic and ginger. I also added some salt as the recipe itself seemed a little bland. It was absolutely tasteless. The best part about these ‚Äúegg rolls‚Äù is the fried skin. Never making these again
Followed the review of doubling the spices and adding a teaspoon of Asian 5 Spice. I also used ground chicken and cooked them in an air fryer. Delicious!
Very bland. I threw in some chrizo to try to add flavor. It helped a lot but it doesn't taste traditional.

I made this as a dish for a Chinese night with about 12 friends and everyone loved them! I Got text asking for the recipe and I would say these were some of the freshest and lightest egg rolls I have had.

I would definitely make again! I made a couple changes, but nothing drastic: I used leftover chicken cut into bite sized pieces. I sauteed mushrooms and onions and added the cabbage with soy sauce and cooked together, before adding the chicken and other spices and cook it all.
I also followed what another review suggested, and brushed them with oil and baked them at 425 for about 20-25 min (I can't remember!). I turned them after a about 13 min, but I don't think that's necessary.
Great recipe!

These are great! Doubled the recipe and used packaged coleslaw mix which already included the carrots plus a package of bean sprouts. Then I added some hoisin sauce and chili garlic sauce for extra flavor. Delish!
Worked! I never made egg rolls before.

Air frying worked well! Put a single layer of 6 egg rolls at a time, turned them after 5 min at 390F then cooked another 3-4 minutes. I also sprayed the egg rolls with cooking spray before air frying. You can taste the difference of not frying in oil but it's worth it. Less calories and less mess to clean up!

This is very close to a recipe I had many years ago. I add two more ingredience. First I added rice noodles. I boiled them for a several minutes then drained. I ran a knife through them to cut them up. The second ingredience is Sesame Seed Oil. I added till I got the taste we like. I never did get any of them to the freezer because my husband kept eating them and taking them to work for lunch. Also, adding the rice noodles helped make more egg rolls.
Recipe was easy, husband and kids loved them. Will definitely fix them again.

Lessons learned. I did not roll them tight enough, but served with Thai Sweet Chili Sauce and they were yummy. Used leftover pork roast diced pretty small and coleslaw mix. Will increase the spices next time to double. Mine made 13 rolls, so leftovers again. Very good!
We loved this recipe. Remember to let the filling cool to room temperature before preparing the roll, otherwise, the egg roll will be soggy and won‚Äôt fry up crispy.

Super easy. Didn't use peanut oil to fry because I didn't have it! Used 8 cups of premix coleslaw mix and hot sausage because that's what I'd inadvertently pulled out of the freezer. The coleslaw mix reduced in volume the minute the warm cooked sausage was combined. Doubled the spices and added chopped cilantro and green onions. Very good and easy, peasy. Made far more than the 8 rolls predicted in the recipe -- about 16-18 rolls. My family was eating them as fast as they were fried! Decadent too but sometimes we all just need that ! Need to find an easy dipping sauce now; the one I threw together was good but needed improvement. Thanks for sharing!

I followed the recipe, but I did double the ginger and garlic powder + adding in minced garlic. The flavor was not hitting right for me and the egg rolls felt empty on the inside because the cabbage shrunk so much. I will do what another reviewer suggested and cook the cabbage first next time. I will also be looking into a different arrangement of spices or just working out a better one myself. I am rating this three stars because I did watch the video multiple times for help with rolling.
Bland, boring. Needs a lot more flavor. I give it 2 because it is a decent base to add onto. I'm still tweaking my flavoring a bit.
We loved them. The only thing different that I did was make them completely dairy casein free.
Fabulous!! I can‚Äôt believe I waited this long to make these! I tripled the recipe for our large family and everyone gobbled them up!
We doubled the ginger and garlic, and used a bag of shredded slaw mix. Delicious! Restaurant egg rolls taste bland and tough after making these.
This recipe is amazing and so easy to make. I have made it several times now and I is always a hit.
Delicious !!!! I just added twice as much spice like someone had mentioned. Great recipe.

I already made twice it was quick & easy & tasted fantastic. 
My mother also asked me for recipe 
I did add a couple of drops of sesame seed oil in veggie mixture. Next time I might add some shrimp into existing mixture I used good egg roll wrappers 
Dipping sauce was sweet chili sauce with a little soy

Super awesome base recipe! And I didn't think it was hard or particularly time-consuming (though it's not a 10-min dish). I did make a bunch of changes, of course. I‚Äôd say 1/3 head finely chopped cabbage, 1 shredded carrot, 4oz finely sliced tofu, 1 minced green onion, 1tsp grated ginger, 1/2 tsp garlic powder, 1/2 tsp sesame oil, 1 tsp sesame seeds (mixed into the veg), and I think I also put some minced jalapeno and turnip in there. Make sure you seal the egg rolls with cornstarch/water. For much, much lower fat content, pan fry in batches in 1tbsp oil on 4 sides til brown. I also made a dipping sauce: 1tbsp each gochujang, honey, ketchup, and 1tsp soy sauce (which is actually a nice general purpose sweet/spicy sauce!). DEFINITELY making this again.
Big Hit with the family! Only change was to change peanut oil due to an allergy and it was divine!

I use about 3/4 bag of cole slaw instead of chopping. I used vegetable oil instead because I didn't have peanut oil. I've made these 4 or 5 times and they are so good! Rolling is tricky and they fry really quickly so don't leave them too long.
I made thia exactly according to the recipe, these were decent, but not very flavorful

I was looking for a recipe to use left over turkey. I came upon This recipe so this pulsed cooked turkey in my food processor then followed the rest of the recipe as written. Oops sorry not quite I sprayed rolls with cooking spray and baked. Will definitely make again very easy. Thanks for sharing
These turned out so well! I added a little extra ginger and used garlic salt because that is what I had. Yummy

Very very bland. I even doubled the garlic and ginger and added a little soy sauce like other reviewers has suggested. I was going to add some salt but decided not to and just added the soy sauce. I knew I should have went with my gut.

I used 2 bags of coleslaw mix and also used a yellow onion and a bunch of green onions. My family likes onion. I used left over pork, chicken and some shrimp I also added 1 Tablespoon of peanut butter mixed with a little vegetable oil. I also upped the ginger and added 5 Spice. I accidentally bought won ton wrappers so when frying the egg rolls I cut the won tons in strips and fried them too. The family loved them! Excellent! I‚Äôve been told I will make them again! I froze a few that were left over. I‚Äôm sure they will be just as delicious as when first made.

I too cooked the cole slaw mixture with water and soy sauce before adding it to the pork. I added green onions as well. I cooked it with brushed peanut oil in the oven for 20 minutes at 425 and the crunch was not that great. I think corn oil would be better. I forgot to turn them 1/2 way through. But the flavor was good. The boys gave me a 6 rating. I then wrapped up the rest of the mixture with spring roll wrappers and also added scrambled egg inside of it. It was more flavorful but the wrappers were too thin and broke. It might work if I double wrapped it with spring rolls. Corn oil did crunch it up better. Update 9/19 You need an awesome dipping sauce for this. Mix together 6TBS Light soy sauce, 3 TBS rice vinegar, 1 tsp chili garlic sauce or even sriracha sauce, 1-2 tsp fresh grated ginger root, 2 TBS brown sugar or white, 1-2 garlic cloves chopped, 1 TBS sesame oil. and a few green onions chopped if you have them. YUM.
This is great base recipe. For those looking for more flavor, a couple of Tbsp of oyster sauce and a couple of Tbsp. of soy sauce really perks the flavor up.

I was expecting it to take a long time to put together, but took no time at all. Will be great for a week night dinner. We loved them. While eating my husband and I started talking about different things we could do with the recipe. Won't go into it now, but if we follow through I'll let you know.
The recipe is pretty good, but as others have stated they are bland as is. Up the ginger, garlic and maybe add some soy sauce.
Makes great spring rolls too- just take out the meat:) Fabulous!!!
Very good, no complaints!
It was so simple and delicious to make egg rolls. A suggestion, try Chinese 5 spice along with the ginger and garlic.
I followed the recipe exactly except I used fresh ginger amd coconut oil just based on what I had. My toddlers absolutely devoured them and hubby loved them too. Definitely a keeper.
Great Recipe will definitely make again!
I'm not a huge fan of pork so I substituted and made this recipe using ground chicken and ground turkey. Both came out very good, big hits with my family.
I added green onions and some of the egg rolls I used two sheets of egg roll paper instead of 1 they came out great. I mixed red and green cabbage with the carrots too.
This recipe is great, i recommend highly
I added salt, fresh ginger and hoisin sauce to the pork, otherwise they would have been very bland. I believe peanut oil to fry them in is the secret! Very good!!
I made these and my family loved them. I will keep this recipe handy as it is very easy to make

easy to make.under whelmed by seasoning. added to it.... I like strong flavors. I did add some terraki sauce to it to make it different, no pork sub. ground , chicken, used fresh ginger 1tsp= 1tblsp fresh. Daughter said these were terrible. we should not eat them but she said not to throw them away she'd take one for the team. I think I liked chef John's egg rolls better.

loved this!!!! everyone loved it. After I cooked the ground pork with the ginger and garlic I put the carrots and the cabbage, garlic powder, onion powder and put a few teaspoon of osyter sauce and cooked it for a few minutes. I let the filling cool and wrapped it in the egg roll wrapper. cooled the the egg rolls and then fried them in vegetable oil. yum!
I followed the recipe but they turned out bland and a little oily. The egg rolls looked good but otherwise were edible. I was able to salvage the filling by scraping it out and making mock moo shu.
easy and excellent what more could you ask for?

The first time I made these I followed recipe except I used minced rehydrated garlic and ground chicken. FABULOUS! Everyone loved them. 

I am now on my second batch of egg rolls. My kitchen smells deliciously of onions, garlic and ginger! The garlic is from a fresh garlic bulb; the ginger (again) is from Lighthouse Herbs (reconstituted) ginger. This ginger saves a lot of time in prep and works equally well. Again using (as suggested by previous readers) a coleslaw mix to which I added more shredded carrots. Used a pizza cutter to shred the coleslaw and carrots finer. Worked great. When mincing the garlic I put Pam Cooking Spray on the blade of the chopping knife. What a great idea! (Don't remember where I read this) Keeps the garlic from sticking. This time I will be using a small electric fryer. The first batch of egg rolls I fried in a regular sauce pan and what a mess! Will see how the fryer works.
Use of packaged coleslaw mix speeds up the process

Best egg rolls ever! I loved them. 
On the advice of others I added Hoisin sauce, red pepper flakes and some green onions. A few reviews said it needed more flavor.

I'm giving this a 4 for being a good start. I worked in a Chinese restaurant all through high school and spent a lot of time rolling egg rolls and wantons. I do love egg rolls with bbq Chinese pork, but used minced chicken this time. I marinated it in pineapple juice, teriyaki sauce , with fresh minced garlic and fresh minced ginger for a couple of hours before cooking it. I also lightly stir fried the veges till softened (cabbage, carrots, bean sprouts, green onion, minced mushrooms & bamboo shoots) before putting it all together for the egg roll. Water works just fine to seal your egg rolls, no flour paste needed. These were a real hit with the family. They freeze well too (reheat 400 for 10-12 minutes) I used Chinese hot mustard and Sweet Chili sauces (from this site) for dipping. Yum!
Absolutely delicious. Not difficult to make. It's a keeper for my family
They were very dry and bland; suggest adding a little stir fry sauce or soy sauce to moisten and season before rolling up egg roll.

These were horribly bland tripled the seasoning. Added soy sauce and green onions. The meat to vegetable ratio was way off. I would try these again and use only half the meat. I brushed them with peanut oil and put them in the air fryer. They came out super crispy. I served with the sesame ginger sauce from this sight
We made these, added shrimp. Loved them ! So easy, will be making often !

easy to put together but made one and then tasted it.. It was missing flavor. the ginger and garlic were not enough. I added another tsp of both ginger and garlic, chopped onions and 3 tbsp of low sodium soy sauce. That did the trick. I also made mine in an air fryer, eliminating the need for deep frying.
